steps: Open Microsoft Word.
Click on the 'File' tab in the top left corner.
Select 'Open' from the dropdown menu.
Navigate to the location of the read-only document (Document11.docx).
Select the document and click on the 'Open' button.
If prompted, enter the password to unlock the document.
Once the document is open, click on the 'Review' tab in the top menu.
Click on the 'Protect Document' button in the 'Protect' group.
Select 'Restrict Editing' from the dropdown menu.
In the 'Restrict Editing' pane on the right side, check the 'Allow only this type of editing in the document' option.
Choose 'No changes (Read only)' from the dropdown menu.
Click on the 'Yes, Start Enforcing Protection' button.
Enter a password to protect the document (optional).
Click on the 'OK' button.
The document is now read-only. To edit the document, you need to remove the protection.
Click on the 'Review' tab again.
Click on the 'Protect Document' button.
Select 'Stop Protection' from the dropdown menu.
If prompted, enter the password to unlock the document.
The document is now editable. You can make changes and save the document.
